snippet: After a judge barred New York City from restricting sales of the large drinks, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s administration asked an appellate court to approve the rules.
abstract: Bloomberg administration is asking an appellate court to allow New York City to limit sale of large sugary drinks, three months after New York State court judge banned city from doing so; city argues prohibition on high-calorie beverages is an innovative way to fight obesity while soft-drink industry says restrictions are bureaucratic overreach approved without legal authority.
lead_paragraph: After a judge barred New York City from restricting sales of the large drinks, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s administration asked an appellate court to approve the rules.

headline.seo: Bloomberg Presses for Reversal of Court Ban on Sugary Drink Limits
headline.main: City Argues to Overturn Ruling That Prevented Limits on Sugary Drinks
headline.print_headline: City Argues to Overturn Ruling That Prevented Sugary Drink Limits
